projects.title: Pohoda Festival Farmers' Breakfast
projects.description: In 2019 I was asked by the Head of Catering at Pohoda to organize “farmers’ breakfast” event during the festival. I chose and negotiated with 6 small-scale farmers that wanted to pursue new markets, helped them get all the necessary legal paperwork in order, and managed the event on the spot. For the next Pohoda Festival (2022), I handed over the management of the event to one of the farmers and kept in touch with the process as a consultant.

projects.title: Analysis: Transforming a 73ha potato monoculture into a nature-inclusive grain farm
projects.description: As part of Academic Consultancy Training course at WUR, I managed a 2-month project for BBROOD, a bakery in Amsterdam that wanted to diversify its business and buy a 73ha piece of land near Groningen. On this land, they wanted to grow their own grains in a "nature-inclusive" way. During the 2 months, I managed a team of 5 Master's students and we successfully created and presented an 80-page report in which we analyzed the field the company wanted to buy, proposed what grain varieties to grow and how to grow them on the specific soil, what other crops to use in the rotations and why, and what nature-inclusive elements to implement so it has the highest possible biodiversity benefit and lowest yield loss.

projects.title: CityU Initiatives
projects.description: After a few months at CityU, me and a couple of my classmates started an informal organization of students and teachers, called CityU Initiatives. Our most notable accomplishments are placing recycling bins into every classroom, organizing field trips, and hosting events like Food 4 Thought where students, teachers and other staff members suggested many good ideas on how to improve our school. After finishing our studies, we handed over the organization to younger students.

profile_positions.description:
After the experience of working at a food delivery startup, I wanted to develop a deeper understanding for the food industry. For that reason, I embarked on a series of internships with high-quality, small-scale food producers in Slovakia. These internships included working at Farma Hiadlovsky, a dairy farm in Slovenska Lupca, Farma Turova, an organic cattle farm and slaughterhouse in Turova, and Vinarstvo Magula, an organic winery in Sucha nad Parnou. 

➤ Immersed in diverse agricultural environments, acquiring practical skills and knowledge in sustainable farming practices 
➤ Undertook daily operational tasks and led small-scale projects that provided insights into the logistics and challenges of running a successful farm
➤ Collaborated with farm owners on marketing and business strategy, learning the nuances of farm-focused entrepreneurship and promotion in a competitive marketplace
